trans-unit.source: Represents a security token that is based upon an X.509 certificate.
To get the details of the X.509 certificate, access the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified X.509 certificate.

This constructor creates a unique identifier for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> security token and assigns that value to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Id%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that contains the X.509 certificate.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate*> property.
certificate is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified X.509 certificate and unique identifier.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that contains the X.509 certificate.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate*> property.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Id*> property.
certificate is .
-or- id is null.
To be added.
Gets the X.509 certificate associated with the security token.
Use the Certificate property to get the details about the X.509 certificate associated with the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> security token.
For instance, the thumbprint of the X.509 certificate can be accessed using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.Thumbprint%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2"></xref> that contains the X.509 certificate.
To be added.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref>.
Call the Dispose method when you are finished using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken>.
The Dispose method leaves the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> in an unusable state.

After calling the Dispose method, you must release all references to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> was occupying.
> [!NOTE] > Always call Dispose before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken> object's `Finalize` method.
Gets a unique identifier of the security token.
A unique identifier of the security token.
Returns a value indicating whether the key identifier for this instance is equal to the specified key identifier.

The MatchesKeyIdentifierClause method matches criteria in the X.509 certificate in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property based on the type of the `keyIdentifierClause` parameter.
The following table details what is matched.

|Key identifier clause type|What is matched| |--------------------------------|---------------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509IssuerSerialKeyIdentifierClause>|The value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.IssuerName%2A> property and the issuer serial number returned from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate.GetSerialNumber%2A> method.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509RawDataKeyIdentifierClause>|The data returned from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate.GetRawCertData%2A> method.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SubjectKeyIdentifierClause>|The subject key identifier extension in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.Extensions%2A> property is matched.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509ThumbprintKeyIdentifierClause>|The thumbprint that is returned by the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate.GetCertHash%2A> method.|
An <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> to compare to this instance.
if keyIdentifierClause is one of the , , , or types and the key identifier clauses match; otherwise, .
Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
Use the SecurityKeys property to set the cryptographic keys for this security token to protect a SOAP message.
The keys can be used, among other things, to digitally sign or encrypt SOAP messages.
A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.
Throws an exception if the ThrowIfDisposed method has been called for this instance.
the ThrowIfDisposed method has been called for this instance.
Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.

The ValidFrom property is specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and is the value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.NotBefore%2A> property of the X.509 certificate specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.
Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and is the value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2.NotAfter%2A> property of the X.509 certificate specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken.Certificate%2A> property.
A <xref:System.DateTime> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
